page.title: 12THE FETE AND CARNIVAL IN ASH
page.content: Every year in Ash,Cartwright & Kelsey School have a Carnival. First there is a procession where people dress up and walk or go on floats around the village The theme this year was "Celebrations" and children dressed up as a Bride & Groom, Presents,a Cake,Fireworks,etc. A fire-engine,marching band & majorette troupe lead the procession. In the school fields,adults run stalls which include coconut-shy,lucky-dip, donkey rides, beefburger and ice-cream stalls and many more.A few older child- ren in the school run competitions and games.This year David Cornet from Radio Kent opened the fete. Entertainment was provided by the school's Gym & Dance Clubs and this year a microlight air-craft and an air- sea rescue helicopter from RAF Manston flew over the school field.We raised over 800 pounds for school funds.
